review: Okay, I'm going to keep it all the way REAL. If you are  looking for fine dining (this probly ain't the spot for you).  If you looking for chain bar food, good drinks and music (on a Friday) .... without having to drive to D.C., this is a great spot.  At the end of the day, we've all been to Fridays, Chili's or Applebees before, so you should know what to expect.

This location should be shut down. From the other reviews I see here, it is evident why, but I'll add my experience in a quick, easy to read format. Before I do I'll preface with I used to come here a lot and enjoy it.  - The bar smelled like a dirty used urinal. Everyone, including the staff was complaining.  - My beer had sediment floating in it. Did not taste great.  - Chicken was rubber. Albeit it did have some flavor.  - I feel bad for employees who have to work here.  At the Fridays in Tyson I had an experience that I won't go into detail about because management corrected it. This location is unsalvageable. That smell was GROSS! Go to the Springfield location. It's your only hope!

It mildly pains me to give this FRIDAY's a less than decent review because I've been a customer here on and off for over 10 Years. On any other occasion I'd give this location 3-Stars because it's rather consistent with what you'd expect from most chain restaurants: 1.) Consistent Food Quality. - 1a.) Consistent Price. - 1b.) Decent Service. Well the last was non existent; not by everyone...just one bartender (who I won't bother naming). Having not been to this Friday's in quite some time, I wasn't up to date on their menu nor happy hour specials. As soon as we sat down the bartender asked us if he could start us with "a long island, margarita." From the beer tap right in front of me...I did the math and figured they had to have more adult beverage offerings. Call me crazy...but I felt it in my guts.  I asked what the happy hour specials were...and with a straight face he said "Long Island, margarita." As a world class A-hole...I typically enjoy other world class A's...I truly do. I didn't enjoy this one. And with that interaction, within 3 minutes of sitting at the bar, we were both quickly soured and the bartender made no efforts at customer service. We weren't asked if we'd like menus. When we received our one menu, it was missing pages. Frustrated I had to ask another bartender for the happy hour specials and a new menu.  Once our drinks came (Long Island for me, Lemon Drop Martini for my lady), my lady asked: "Taste this. Is it missing something." "Yeah. Alcohol." ...from there the food was as expected, and the service on par with not that that great...including long wait periods and no checking how our food drinks were. It was highly disappointing overall.  Here's a bit of advice: if you're not feeling the vibe of your server or bartender, trust me, ask for another one or move to another side of the bar. Cheers!

THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER! Came here for happy hour with my coworkers. Upon entering, we waiting about 5 minutes to be seated. The hostess did not even bother to ask how many will be with our party. My coworker asked her if we'll still be able to get the 1/2 off appetizer deal if we sit in the dining area versus the bar and the hostess said yes. We were seated for about 15 minutes and no one had come to our table to get us drinks or take our orders. My coworker flagged down the hostess and asked if she was our server, the hostess said no and walked away.. did not even say "I can find your server for you." 5 minutes passed and there was someone bussing the table behind us so I asked him if he was our server. He responded with "I've been here since 7am and I am about to get off." Again, did not even try to help us get a server. Another 5 minutes passed and the same server finally came to our table and said "looks like you're stuck with me, I'll be your server." Obviously they overwork their servers and this bad energy is transferred onto the customers.  We asked him if we'll be able to get the 1/2 off appetizer deal like the hostess said and he told us that it does not apply to the dining area. We were very disappointed because the main reason we went to TGI Friday's was for that deal and if we had known from the beginning, then we would've sat in the bar area. But the hostess did not bother telling us the correct information.  We tried to flag down one of the managers to share the horrible experience we have had so far. He told us he couldn't do anything about it and made us feel like it was wrong to even share how we felt about our experience with him. I told him that this will be going on the Yelp review and this is the point where it gets really weird.. he asked for my ID because he said that I don't look old enough to be drinking an alcoholic beverage. I told him that the server already checked our IDs when we ordered our drinks. The manager demanded to see it and pulled the "I'm the manager, I can do whatever" card.. I showed him my ID since I had nothing to hide. This is when he said "okay so if I see a bad review under your name, I will come find you" I told him "okay unless you have a photographic memory and memorized my address in the two seconds you saw my ID, then sure" he again stated "I will find you if I see a bad review." My coworkers and I started getting very creeped out and politely asked him to let us continue with our dinner. He continued to hover and make things even more awkward. It was the worst experience I had ever had anywhere and unless you want to get threatened then DO NOT COME TO THIS TGI FRIDAYS!!
Bad experience all around. Orders mixed up and wrong. Never ever going back. Too much wrong to even begin to explain.

We had takeout on a Saturday night.  Took awhile for it to be ready. Food was alright.  Typical Fridays fare. Appetizers were pretty tasty, we had the sesame jack chicken strips and the pretzel bread. Honestly the dipping sauce for the bread could have been hotter.   Husband enjoyed the Jack Daniels Burger.  He said it was on par with other similar restaurant burgers.  Unfortunately for me, my chicken sandwich was undercooked. Boo!

Had the worst service ever. Got sat down and didn't get our drinks or even glasses of water for 30 mins. Then when we asked for service, the waitress, Alexis (wearing big glasses) put her hand up and kept walking away. Then we waited another 10 mins with an excuse from her that she had too many people.  She didn't serve our appetizers together, and it take 10 mins between each appetizer (4 total). She was very disrespectful, slamming dishes on table, and then putting her hand out to make us wait when we needed something. Other 3 tables she was serving had issues as well. They were upset. She didn't give us utensils after our food came and then she didn't give us the right amount of utensils when she did. She also kept bumping my arm with dishes and didn't say excuse me. She has to be the worst server ever. On top of that, there was no management present.  DON'T GO HERE!
Terrible service, terrible food.  Worst experience i have had a tgi ever.  Then add insult to injury, shortly after l left i had to pull the car over to vomit!!!!  Food poisoning

This restaurant was not really my type of place, My seat wasn't really giving us any privacy, the booths are to small, and they use glass to separate us from the people next to us, then there was the service, the waiters were very pushy and kept asking us if we wanted to order anything else, even after we said no, twice. (If we want to order anything then we will ask them). Although this might be because it's New Year's Day. I don't take that as an excuse, and they need to be consistent with their service. The food on the other hand was good. Depending on your choice although an the other hand some foods might not be as good, depending on my opinion. Overall the restaurant gets two stars not because of the food, but because of what many other restaurants get rated on, it was the service.

I came to Friday's to enjoy my friends bday and there was no host to seat us. So we sat ourselves and then MR LIGHTSKIN said " you gotta be sat by the host" uuuhhhhh yeeeeaaaa where can I find her because she WASNT AT THE DOOR.  we were finally sat and our server "MR. LIGHTSKIN" never ever came by to greet us or anything for like 20 mins. So we took our asses to the bar and then we waited for another 25 mins for some kind of service!!!! I do not think I will be coming back here ever again!!!! The over cooked my friends steak and then they under cooked it the second time around. Management needs to do something to accommodate us because we are leaving hungry and upset!!!!!!!!! I will be spreading the word that this is THE WORST LOCATION

I like what I call "Club Fridays" at TGIFridays! I used to go to TGIF all the time when I was in high school and college. Then it was once every couple of years. But now with "Club Fridays" I probably will go more often. The first time I experienced "Club Fridays" was years ago when I met a friend for an impromptu meeting in Laurel. About two hours in, a DJ set up by the bar and it turned almost into a club before my very eyes. I could not believe it!  The bar area was packed, the music was loud, and people were having a goooood time. I thought it was just that location until last night. I went to a Fridays on King St. to meet up with folks. We ate, we chatted....and again after a couple of hours....we saw the DJ set up and the bartenders were busy. Add to that the game was on.....packed! So "Club Fridays" is a thing now! Oh and the $10 app deal is good. Order any of the ones listed and you can reorder the same item or a different one.....still pay just $10 total! Wish there was one healthy/healthier option included (like a garden salad...use iceberg if you have to but include something naturally green). Service is slow (they need to hire someone to bus tables). They won't take your plate until you leave so order away but your table will be filled with plates. If you are looking for a spot to chill at night, check out TGIFridays. At least on Thursday nights. Parking is free.

If you've been to one Tgi Friday you've been to them all. Just a chain restaurant with good drinks and an even better crowd. They do have music on certain days but I'm not sure which days, my guess would be Friday and Saturday night. Parking at this location is abundant. Food is your average bar food, but the wings are really good. I love there potstickers too. They always have drinks specials and depending on which side of the bar you sit on, you may not be able to get back up, lol. I personally wouldn't go out if my way to visit, but if I'm driving by I'd stop by and grab a drink or two or five.... whateve!!

Ordered buffalo wings as appetizer. Asked for silverwaure 3 times before we got it. Asked for nakins l.. came after we were done with our appetizers. My steak came well done when i asked for medium. I asked to see a manager. And im still waiting on a manager to come see me while im writing this review. It been exactly 15 mins that i asked to see a manager!... KUDOS!!!! NO WONDER THIS LOCATION HAS 2 STARS

I ordered mine to go and it was pretty fast and tasted great. The only issue I had was the parking which was not good at All! The illegally parked vehicle in the front really didn't help either since the driving space is so narrow to begin with.

The $10 unlimited apps is an insanely out of this world great deal. For clarity, you don't have to stick to just one app. Don't expect to get more than 3 apps out of this deal, because after the second app, the kitchen/staff will purposefully take over 20 minutes to bring out another additional app. 3 apps for $10? Still a pretty awesome deal.

This Friday's is a club that serves franchise-provided food. Nothing more, but maybe less.  It might take you a while to get greeted and/or seated. After that, your server is going to quite unprofessional. Nice, but unprofessional.  The food is Friday's food. If you like Friday's food, you'll enjoy the food at Friday's.  When that Friday's food comes out, there's a good chance your server won't know what you ordered or how to pronounce it. Roll with it. Just get to the food. The Friday night DJ is not great so I hope you're not going for music.  Enjoy.

Excellent food and service! After being very disappointed at the GW University location and walking out due to waiting and poor service, my partner and I decided to have lunch at this location, and we are glad we did. The moment we arrived we were greeted and seated immediately. Our waitress introduced her herself immediately and took our orders. Everything was cooked to perfection! We will definitely be coming back to this location! Thank you for a wonderful dining experience!

If there was a way to give zero stars I would. We walked in, sat down and ordered four endless apps, four drinks and one water. 45 minutes later we had no drinks, no water and two cold apps. At this point we inquired about canceling our order and leaving with another waitress because we couldn't find our own. However before she found our waiter some food appeared. Two were still missing; the flatbread was cold with unmelted cheese and one of the potato skins barely had anything in it.  The manager came over upon request and took off the drinks and the two apps we did not receive. No additional discount, no apology.

I arrived with a group of 5 people at this location late Thursday night last week, greeted by the unwelcoming hostess at the entrance who could barely speak any English. We chose this specific location because of the late open hours it offered.  Upon arrival at this time of the night, this TGI Friday's seemed more of a biker bar with over 50 motorcycles parked out front where all the bartenders and waitresses focused on the bikers at the bar, and didn't attend to the rest of the customers on the restaurant floor.  We were told by her that they were packed and no tables were available for the size of our group when there was clearly multiple open tables around the restaurant. The hostess seemed unwilling to be proactive to arrange together two tables for us and seemed like as it we were an inconvenience to her. We were literally about to walk out after waiting almost 30 minutes to be seated when we could see more than 10 tables open around the restaurant. We were customers arriving, willing to spend money on your establishment hence I shouldn't have to beg for a seat.  There were no managers in sight, and only one(1) waitress for the entire restaurant. The service was so horrendous that even at the time to pay the bill we literally had to all go to the front hostess because our waitress was nowhere to be found.This was completely unsatisfactory, the food was excellent which is the bare minimum a restaurant must offer. Customer service was nonexistent.

Honestly I used to love this place especially their menu and drinks is what kept me coming. But multiple times I've had to wait 20-30 min for a waiter to greet and assist or drinks to be brought to our table. This place is checked out from my go-to list.

Came in with my partner on a quiet Monday lunch. We sat at the bar and shared delicious pork dumplings. The French onion soup was awesome, the French dip with fries was spot on and my partner's salmon was perfection.  Kudos to our bartender for their impeccable suggestions and delicious cocktails.  Well done.
Food was and the place looks good.  The service was pretty slow over all.  We had to ask for the same items a few times and we were looking for the server several times for follow up.

Terrible management. My wife worked today one of the employee stole $50.00 out of her bag, they saw who did it and they did nothing to that employee. They are now accuse my wife of being late for 2 hours because she did not have money for the bus because that employee stole the money. Her manager had a disrespect for myself and my wife when handling the situation. After the situation above happened, I will put the truth to the quality of the food being served. Normally I would never admit this stuff but you don't allow theft and then disrespect that victim and her family. So here are the truth about this store. My wife who works there said that the shrimp was dropped on the floor and afterwards she observed the cook put it in oil and served it to the customer. Another employee was upset at a customer so she dragged a lemon across the table, mashed it all over the wall and then served it to a customer. She states that the kitchen is dirty and its not properly cleaned with the tools being served. To clean the dishes because the dishwasher is sorta broken they will just use a napkin to remove dirt and grease to make it look as if its the appearance its clean. Don't drink the liquid with ice, the buckets carrying ice is completely filthy.

Not worth my time and money and very disappointed. Will not return. Went in on a Tuesday evening with a small group and hostess was unable to timely sit us even thought half the tables were empty. The 15minute wait seemed unreasonable and unacceptable. Overall cleanliness left much to be desired. Most of the floor was sticky and  covered in crumbs/dirt.  Once seated waited 10+minutes for the waitress to greet us. Food took over 45min to be cooked. One of the dishes, bruschetta pasta, had to be returned as the chicken was extremely dry and hard.  Overall, the server was courteous and professional. The manager, after offering some excuses, adjusted our bill and provided a discount.

I would give this place a 0 star rating if it were not for Wagner. We went to enjoy appetizers 2 hours before our movie. I have been working in the restaurant for 10+ years ( as a server/ bartender/ and now a manager). There were 3 bartenders WAGNER was running circles around the two lackluster bartenders. Who blatantly ignored us, it was like we were not there. We sat and waited for about 6 minutes until WAGNER came back from the  took care of us. Just shitty service all around except for Wagner!

The food has improved, as has service and all around atmosphere is more friendly.   My complaint is that the suggested gratuities are inflated by about 6 or 7%.  They do not reflect the true 18%, 20% and so on but about 6 or 7 percent more than they state they are showing.  This feels really scammy and i cant believe they would risk doing that intentionally.  Unfortunately i did not photograph my receipt- just be sure to use your OWN calculations when tipping- watch out!

Been to this Friday's multiple times, never a good experience. Service is always slow. Today was the icing on the cake, I was starving and excited to eat because it wasn't very busy. Girlfriend and I were seated and waited 15-20 and no server showed up. Done with any restaurant in this area, all of their service is f*cking shit. Thanks for reading.

1 Star ONLY  because the manager rectified the issues. Service was terrible, my food was not out in. I waited over 40 min for boneless wings that never came. There was no DJ so the place was not busy at all ! Actually a let down for a Friday night, nevertheless there was no reason for my food to take that long. When I asked for the manager it took a short while for him yo come but when he did he tried to find the server and resolve the issue. While waiting I watched them and another employee argue about tables and whose got what... EXTREMELY UNACCEPTABLE!! Mean while instill had no food. Once the waiter returned he offered to get the food I wanted but I did not want it. The manager eventually rectified issue.

I'm giving 2 stars because I really liked the staff there but cleaningness and baby equipment was just a disaster.  First, we asked for 2 high chairs as there were 5 months and 9 months old baby. High chairs are Dirty and it doesn't have the proper buckles for the baby. It's those plastic kind that looks so dirty. I guess it's gray but it looks much darker that it's original color as it appears they never wash it.  Second, the changing table in the restroom is also filthy. The buckle had these brown dirt that fall on my baby's clothes. It was disgusting!!!!! On top of that, the buckle was brown so they tied it to the other lose end too.  Lastly, restroom itself was not clean at all. There was a vomit on the handicapped room door and most of the rooms were out of toilet paper. I did not feel sanitary using that restroom at all. so I made sure I washed my hands with hot water before I left the restroom. Disgusting.

Stopped by Wednesday evening after work and ordered the new Fish & Chips. The waitress delivered the food with no Tartar Sauce.  After waiting about 10 minutes I caught her attention and asked for some tartar sauce and was advised they do not have any. I was never offered a substitution.

It must be the heat, was hot and humid on this August evening, that we decided to re live our youth and head to TGIF after almost 10 years.  Big mistake, some of the worst food I have tasted and the service? Enough said. Sticky, dirty tables, cold inedible food. The mozzarella sticks our kid got were the highlight of our dinner.

One star and one star only. Too bad I had to rate it but I guess it will be one star. The manager sat us quickly so it wasn't much of a wait time. Then the waitress that we had wasn't friendly at all and made  my boyfriend feel like an asshole because of a question that he asked regarding substituting a side from what he ordered. Where we were sitting was a bit drafty so we asked if we can move. My boyfriend asked the hostess and they were like, "we can turn the heat up". Then they decided to move us. Once they brought out our meal, the same waitress had a Attitude over that we moved and we were inconveniencing her. We asked for silverware, it looked like she was sneering at us and put it on our table. My boyfriend looked at me and said "I don't think that I am welcome here". I've been coming here for years. Seen constant change in management and to be honest with you I don't think I would ever come back here.
Just okay. Nothing special about this place. Service was average compared to other similar businesses.

Only reason I gave two stars is because of the adorable, helpful hostess...I think she had brown hair. She was great. However, this TGI is run so poorly! They need to bring in new management ASAP. The management also yells at the kitchen so loud you can hear it from your table. Friday's, PLEASE GET NEW MANAGERS!!!!

My waiter got my order all wrong and we ended up paying more than we wanted to. Not to mention, we actually wanted Jack Daniel ribs but he served us the regular ribs in which we had to wipe the barbecue sauce off with a paper-towel. We understood that he was new (2 months in) so we let it go. But overall, I will not be back. Even the hostess (male, probably Ethiopian/Eritrean) did not greet us properly - we walked in looking bewildered because no one approached us and employee's were hanging on furniture chatting and in their phone. I think the new technology (iPads to take orders) they are using is doing more harm than good. We still tipped our waiter because he was pretty pleasant! He just needs a little more training.

Service was especially disorganized despite not being terribly busy. We were promptly seated to a table with that apparently had no server assigned to it. After 15 minutes and seeing the tables around us being waited on and no one had come by ours, we told the hostess. About 10 minutes later, she reseated us about 2 tables away from our original table. The server came about 5 minutes after that. They never brought the high chair we requested. They almost brought us an appetizer we didn't order (which we at first assumed was to make amends), but it turns out he was just at the wrong table.

I came here during lunch and Crystal was my server. Crystal was great! She is very attentive and was very kind.  I ordered some buffalo wings and they were great, just enough sauce and the wings weren't too skimpy on the meat either. Then we got the Cajun chicken and shrimp pasta to split and she automatically split them on 2 different plates without us even having to ask.  When we arrived the place wasn't very busy at all, just a few regulars at the bar it seemed like and then a few tables outside the bar. My only complaint though was that the manager who sat us, gave us dirty menus that had a previous guest's napkin still stuck on it. The manager out of all people should've known that that's just gross.

Horrible service. When I walked in at 11:00 AM I had to wait 5 minutes for someone to come out.  A woman who works in the kitchen carrying bulk food  greeted me. Since it was my first time ordering take out I asked how many pieces in the brownie platter which it took a manager to find out.  Then when the food was ready then had no plates or serving utensils for the salad platter, wings , skins, and brownies. They said they had nothing so I asked for take out containers which they gave me the very small ones. They gave me plastic forks and napkins but no plates. It gets better they forgot to give me the Caesar salad dressing.  They have two employees who are fantastic that carried the food to my car. The rest were completely indifferent and the managers attitude was even more apathetic. I hope a regional manager reads this so he can either train the staff or clean house.  Never ever going back.

Arrived when they first opened. There were two other tables sat. Hostess was great.  She sat us upstairs. Server was just there for the paycheck I could tell. I ordered my drink waited a couple of minutes for it to arrive. Placed my food order and was just looking around trying not to be rude to my lunch buddy. Then it happened.....I saw a mouse. It ran across the floor into a hole that was on the stairs. Since  I only had my drink, I left five dollars on the table and bounced. Will not return.
Horrible service. The bar tender said he didn't have control over the channels then changed it once we complained to management. The service was rude and non responsive to our needs.

Normal Friday's. Nothing special about it. First time I've ever had two things happen, one is a small amount of chopped up bacon on my Jack Daniels burger. It's always been slices all over the county. Maybe they are running low on bacon and by dicing up a slice it looks like more?? Not sure the reason behind this. Secondly I was in my second Stella and not even done with my burger and the waitress (Terra) brings the check to the table and says "when your ready"?? What?? Are you ready for me to go so hopefully you can get a larger group at this table and make more tips?? I am not ready to go and would have ordered another beer or two. Its only halftime and the Spurs are up, maybe I am not ready to go??

This review is based on 7 years working at this store, I have eaten here literally hundreds of times. Food is standard fridays fare (almost all of which arrives frozen on a truck, and almost nothing is made in the store) food is extremely inconsistent, ranging from properly cooked to inedibly overcooked, depending on who is working that day. Kitchen also has had an ongoing pest problem for the last 7+ years, mice and roaches, management turns over to frequently to actually fix the problem.Service is also highly inconsistent and due to the nature of the job, the turnover rate is extremely high, meaning you will most likely be served by someone who has been there a few months and will likely be gone in a few more and thus has little knowledge of the  operation.  In my opinion the only reason to visit would be to see Wagner, the head bartender who has been working there for over 32 years and is very knowledgeable, but I still can't give it more than 1 star. Do not care about burning bridges because I will never go back.
Sorry folks, you can't win here.  I enjoy Friday's when I travel but this one is not up to par.  It's just not good.  Service is subpar even though the place is not busy.

Last night me and my ladies went to Friday's for a few drinks, appetizers and great convo. My brother also went he knows everyone. We all got different $10 appetizers and shared them. All of them are good except the union dumplings. I had $6 Long Island I think it was blueberry flavor either way it was not good. My cousin had a $11 sangria abs she said it was delicious not sure what kind. It was orange and looked tropical. Our waiter was not personable and seemed a bit timid and shy. We told him to keep checking our drinks and keep filling our appetizers And he did. So it was a good experience next time we will come later so we can enjoy the dj. The DJ doesn't get there until 8 pm.

I can't believe how poor the service has gotten. I use to come here when I lived in Alexandria and it was good.  This trip back it was like everything had declined.  It took forever to get our order.  I ordered soup and asked it to delivered when everyone else got their food, it wasn't they brought it out way before the rest.  One of the folks at our table ordered the Bourbon Chicken and the waiter came back to table about 10 minutes later and said they couldn't make because they were out of cheese, she said it doesn't come with cheese.  When she got her meal it turns out they were out of mozzarella cheese for tomato salad, why didn't they say that and ask her to choose another side.  At the end of the meal we ordered sundaes for the kids, after 20 minutes they came back and said they were out of vanilla ice cream but they had Oreo ice cream so we said ok.  We waited another 20 minute for that and it had set out for a while because it was melting when it arrived.  This place needs to get new management and train the wait staff better.  We were there a total of 2 hours and 15 minutes.   None of us will ever go back to eat there.  Not sure I will ever eat at a TGIF again.

Went to visit this Fridays for the first time after recently moving to the Alexandria area. My family was in town from NY on their first night and we wanted to get out after a long day of shopping for a quick bite to eat. I was sorely mistaken. We walked in on a Saturday afternoon around 4p.m, which is a decent time considering how busy Saturday evenings can be. But again, this is Fridays; not really a popular spot to dine these days. So when I walked in  I was shocked that there was a 15-20 min wait. I am a pretty patient person but my one year old niece, is not. My sister and I did the best we could to keep her entertained as much as one can with a baby in a public place and after 30 minutes, I was getting upset. Again, the place was pretty slow so I gave them the benefit of the doubt and suspected that they were short on staff at the moment.  After about 40 minutes, everyone who walked in before and after me were either seated or had left the building. So I walked up to the hostess who was flirting with another employee and asked can I be seated. She asked for my name again and said "OH! I'm sorry we gave your seat away, your next!"  Unbelievable to say the least. I looked at her and told her to take my name off the list and left. I will not be back and would not recommend this place to anyone. And judging by the reviews I am not alone on that notion.

I am done with Fridays.  Now, first off, it's TGI Friday's.  I know not to expect too much.  But my last visit here has made me decide, never again. I have been coming to this Fridays on/off for a few years.  Usually for take-out food.  This past weekend, no one could decide what to get for dinner, it was getting late and I did not feel like cooking.  So we ordered from Fridays, like I've done numerous times in the past.  I get into my car, drive there, navigate their terribly awkward parking lot and go inside.  We're told that the food isn't quite ready.  No big deal.  So we sit and wait.  And wait.  And wait.  And wait.   As I am sitting there, getting increasingly angry, not one employee stopped to apologize, ask if we were ok, nothing.  The restaurant was no where near as busy as I've seen it on other occasions.  Finally, the food is ready.  The guy at the take-out window explained that the kitchen was backed up and they just made our order.  Ok.  Fine.  Piping hot fresh food is worth the wait.  Nope. When we get home to eat the food (3 minute drive away), we see that most of the food is ice cold.  The mashed potatoes are hard lumps, chicken dry as a bone and cracking on the outside, the "sizzling" cheese was congealed into a hard lump coating the bottom of the container and cold, un-cooked french fries.  The best thing was my son's burger, which we all stared longingly at while he ate it.  I've never wanted to take food from my child's mouth before in my life, but man, was I tempted. I can look past all the other problems that I've had with Fridays.  But this last visit was just too much.  Ugh.

If I could rate this place with a negative star, I would. Service was absolutely TERRIBLE. The wrong orders were given to us three times and then our order was given to the wrong table. When we finally got our order, it was cold. Won't be going back.
Save your time and your money.  Service was abominable and the waitress' attitude was horrible.  The best thing there was the door that leads to the parking lot!

I rarely rate only one star but this was a disappointing experience in many ways.  The temperature of the  restaurant was too cold.  After requesting that they give the AC a rest, they did.  However a few minutes later they felt the need to put it back on.  Apparently, they felt guests needed even colder conditions than the chilly October weather.  As for the food, the  chicken entrées when they were finally served were dry because they were overcooked.  They apologized because they were unable to serve Diet Coke since their machine was broken.  Our server was friendly but not very attentive.  The sink faucet in the rest room was broken.  All this came to $30 plus tip. Needless to say we wont be back.
Nobody was at the door to seat is. After being seated didnt have a waitress for 30 minutes! Others sat themselves and told to move because table wasn't clean instead of cleaning the table.

TGIF really isn't my cup of tea. My fiancée enjoys this place so I come along. The atmosphere is the best part, if you're into the loud sports bar type of thing this place isn't for you.  The drinks are weak, hardly ever any alcohol and the food is mediocre.

I'm at Fridays now this is the second time in 2 months a h as ce a real problem with the fact that the company seems to think it's okay to play the music so loud you can't talk to your waiter or you companion at the table w/O yelling and that might not work,  please do something about this because I love the food and been a fan fir over 20 yrs,  thanks

I haven't been to this location since they remodeled, so that lets you know it must have been 8 years ago, at least.  I was pleasantly surprised at the new renovations.  The space looks very much like a bar and not a family restaurant.  This is a plus for me, not a minus. And I would guess that is the direction the management was trying to take this bar because this place is PACKED on a Friday night for happy hour.  Ladies, this is where all the single men are on a Friday night.  The bar was overflowing with young professionals.  I loved it! TGI Fridays will always be a staple for me because of their happy hour specials.  Other venues need to take note, this is how it's done! $3 appetizers and $4 drinks.  Man, it seriously doesn't get much better than this.  Even if you use this a pregame spot, your pockets will be happy. Trust that.

Let me just start off saying this BEWARE OF ROACHES! My friend and I decided to stop in for happy hour and the food was regular. We sat at the bar and just as we were about to ask for boxes and pay our tab a roach ran across the bar !! Omg I was speechless! The manager had the nerve to come out & say that they just sprayed last weekend so it probably brought more of them out !! They need to shut down! I will never go back !

Enjoyed Fridays!  Server Rob, I believe that was his name, (tattoos and a small beard, physical description incase I got the name wrong) was super fun and friendly! Very nice and funny! I will definitely be back and request him. I ordered the Jack Daniel's chicken and shrimp to eat really enjoyed the food! The JD sauce is bomb!  They have plenty of specials and low priced drinks.  I really love coming to Fridays and I will continue to come back with my friends.

My bf and I stopped here for a quick bite while we were in the area for the weekend. We figured it was something we knew, we enjoyed, and that we had coupons for so it was definitely a go. Upon arrival, we stood at the front for about 8 mins until the host arrived. When he finally came up front, he bundled together crumbled sheets of paper into his arms from all over the host desk, then said that there would be a 15 min wait & asked for our names. We gave him our name & he scribbled the name down on one of the disheveled papers in his arms. 15 mins later, he took us to our table. But the worst was yet to come at this point. Throughout the night, the series of crappy events continued. First, our waitress took forever to come to the table. She was clearly irritated with the other staff. No warm or fuzziness at all. She took our app order & food order at the same time, which was as we wanted it, then disappeared into the kitchen to place the order. 20 mins later a different waitress arrives with food for our table that we did not order. We explained that it wasn't ours & she apologized then walked to another table, then walked back to the kitchen, as if she had no idea where she was supposed to be going. 20 mins later, the same thing happened with another order & a different waitress. When we explained this wasn't our order, she asked another waiter about the table numbers where he replied "I don't know" & they continued to have their (clearly agitated) conversation right in front of our table, expressing their frustrations. Not professional at all. But it's not over. This happened ONE MORE TIME following the arrival of our appetizer. A waitress came with the wrong food as our waitress came with our correct food. As she was placing our food on our table, she and the befuddled waitress with the wrong food engaged in an argument about how this wasn't the table number she was looking for. During their argument, another gentlemen showed up at our table with a blue motorcycle drink & placed it in front of my bf......who does not drink liquor...... Our waitress snatched it from the gentleman's hand & proceeded to walk it to another table she was working. By that time, my bf & I had asked for boxes & we're ready to head out. We'd had enough of this hell hole. But I decided to take one bite from my pasta ..... Which was delicious, but a freaking inferno. I mean PIPING hot, as if they put it in the microwave. My tongue is still burnt. By that point, we had had it with this circus. As we exited, I vowed to write a Yelp review, something I had never done before but loved reading. Anddddd here I am.  The food was delicious as always, but the waitstaff had to be part of an entertainment show hired for the evening. It was so awful, it was borderline funny. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone unless they wanted take out. The only reason I gave it one star was because Yelp is making me play nice. Steer clear !

Step dad wanted to come eat here for Father's day. The place wasn't packed at all. There were 5 of us, and we each ordered our own entrees and 2 appetizers for the whole table.  Finally the food came, and everyone got their dish except for my sister. My sister suggested I take a shot every time he comes back to say "Your order will be out in a few more minutes". Good thing I didn't play her game.  At first I thought that they were serving the customers at the bar watching the NBA first, but then I overheard our waiter say to one of the hosts that the cooks in the kitchen were so behind on their orders because they were too busy watching the game too.  On top of that, our poor waiter was being bombarded with questions by this other customer who was eating alone about the restaurant not having something that was on the online app. How in the world is the waiter supposed to know anything about that? That guy was clearly complaining to the wrong person, slowing down the service even more. Service, pretty disappointing. The food was pretty basic; such a simple menu. Most of the stuff on there was just chicken and shrimp with some mashed potatoes.. Or steak and some fries.. Or some pasta with some chicken and shrimp. Save your money, and make some instant mashed potatoes, steak, or pasta at home. Might as well, since it tastes the same anyway. Food, also pretty disappointing.

Well, the wait staff was awesome but I ended getting salmonella food poisoning from the meal, as confirmed from my trip to the ER for uncontrollable food poisoning symptoms. I had the burger....so be warned.
Disgusting!!! Food was served and I could see the waiter's extremely long nails in my food!  Needless to say, my appetite was shot.

Like many in the NOVA area, I have frequented TGI Fridays for their cheap and long happy hour and for being a solid last-resort choice when you can't decide where to go with a significant other/group of friends. It's generally the same lackluster result every time at different locations. For this particular location, however, they get the brunt of my disdain. My girlfriend has an odd obsession with Fridays. Her usually sound logic and reasoning skills tend to be thrown to four winds when she is under the unnatural red and white glow of their store sign.  With my prior bad experiences at other locations, I'm generally reluctant to go. Every now and again, in order to stay in her good graces on that particular day, I will tag along.  In the past three months I think she has dragged me to this location four times. Out of these four times, I think we've eaten a meal a total of once. We were literally pleading for them to take our money and couldn't get any service. None! One of those times, we said we wanted to sit in the bar area (which was full, happy hour) and offered to take a small table in the behind-the-bar section. While reminding the hostess twice, We waited 20 min to get seated. All the while, the table we were eventually sat at was empty the entire time.  It took the server another 10 min to come by. Yeah, we left.  Personally, I'm not a big fan of waits. Now, the icing on the cake was the latest visit here.  On Sunday 3-16-14, the odd itch to eat Fridays returned to my life companion. This time, I decided I wouldn't complain (as much as usual at least) my way out if this one. It took a couple minutes to get seated, but the hostess apologized, no biggie. There weren't any Irish beers for St. Paddys in stock even though a sign at the hostess stand said the special was for the whole weekend. Again, not a big deal, I didn't really want to drink anyway. Our waitress was actually friendly and attentive, told us about the special appetizers, and made sure our drinks were full. Hey, this visit has some promise! Aside from my steak feeling a little colder than normal on a med-rare, The food was actually decent and arrived quickly. Then there was the salted caramel cake, oh man was that thing delicious! Sounds like a good visit you say? Why the harsh one star rating? Well, let's fast forward to 3am when I had to visit the bathroom every hour for about 8 straight. It was like a re-creation of the exorcist from my mouth and my butt. Fun times indeed. I knew something was up with the steak because of the temperature, but it wasn't overly bloody nor did it taste bad. I should have went with my instincts on that one. How do I know it was from Fridays? That was literally the only thing I ate differently with a group of four all that day. Everything else was safe home cooked stuff. On the bright side, I'm off the hook from having to deal with TGI's terrible service and mediocre food for at least a year!

BAD SERVICE, VERY UNCLEAN, COCKROACHES walking around on walls and the floor!!! My friends and I have seen .. This place has unfriendly bartenders who just want to do their shift and get off. No smiling faces just rush rush ..
Surprising I absolutely love the brand new renovated & modern TGIFs!!  My FAV item is the spicy queso!

Good service and they have game pads for kids and adults, to include a trivia game that is played around the country. Food was pretty good but I have been to other BWW locations where it seemed better in years past.  However, I would still give it a good rating. I will check it out again sometime, for sure.
I just stood at the host stand for 15 minutes without even being addressed.  I think that was a good indicator about how the rest of the service would have been.

WTF? I ordered a 1/2 rack of ribs and a food runner brought a full rack. Oops. Our server then comes up, acknowledged that I got more than I asked for, then says she'll be right back to figure out where they went wrong. He comes back with a small plate and scoops half the ribs off my plate and takes them! In hospitality, if it's the merchants mistake, you don't scoop half my food off my plate! Really?!  And eww! If they're going to serve those ribs to someone else! I could have rubbed my spit all over them for all they know!  Otherwise, our server Bella was great.
I don't know why the low reviews, but I love this place.  They always get my food right and the staff is nice.  My jack daniels burger is always PERFECT.

I went to TGI Fridays on 08/17/15 at approximately 6 pm. I had a burger, fries, apple drop with vodka. The food was good and the waiter, Derrick was awesome. He is a people person and has a great sense of humor. Even though my date was difficult to please far as food and drinks, he He still maintained his professionalism and he was very courteous to my date. Yes my friend, she can be a hand full.  When I left the restaurant, I left my wallet on the table by accident. Derrick brought my wallet outside to me in the parking lot. That was very kind of him. I was visiting the DMV from Charlotte, NC. The next time I am in the DMV I will make sure that visit the TGI Fridays on King St.

Placed a call-in order for a Jack Daniel's burger and Yucatan chicken salad on 12/6/2014.  A TGIF employee placed my order but did not ask for my name or phone number.  Fortunately the order was processed as my food was ready upon arriving.  The orders were correct and proportionately sized in the to-go box.  My only fret was the that my burger was cold even though I'm less than 5 minutes away.  I'll probably just dine-in from this point forward rather than using take-out.  But based on this experience it is a viable option if deemed necessary.

Love the rewards program! Our server tonight is Kim. So far so good. She took a while to bring my Margarita and come back to check on us but so far so good. Dinner is over. It was stupidly packed in there which caused us to receive really slow service.  Overall I had a good experience and Kim was really patient. Drinks were good food was good.

Came here with my sister this afternoon. Our waiter was great, our food was decent, just a typical TGI Fridays... but, oh, for the love of god and all that is holy, do NOT come here on a Sunday when there is a football game! There was a huge group of drunk guys by the bar just screaming and carrying on for the entire duration of the game. Impossible to carry on a conversation. Not to mention that the most obnoxious member of their party kept ogling us the whole time from across the room. Ladies, you may want to take your Sunday brunches somewhere else until football season is over. Edit: Just want to include that my 3 star rating has nothing to do with the obnoxious dudes by the bar. Friday's get's 3 stars because it is just an average, mediocre type of place.

The service here rarely meets the basics. The food is rarely done correctly. I've had cold dishes to bad service. The only reason I came is because it's open until 2. According to the waiter they also may not accept vertical IDs. Mine isn't expired. I don't see why places don't find it valid.

Excellent wait staff. I've been here multiple times when on business trips and the food is always good and the service is well above average. It's a large restaurant/ bar but on a crappy corner with limited parking. Nice atmosphere with large bat and plenty of flats to watch whatever game is on.

Absolutely ridiculous. We have tried this place three different times, and only once did we actually get a table and food. The last time we were there (July 24th), we watched the host engage into conversations (I assumed they were personal, as she laughed and hugged various other employees), despite glancing toward us. There were at least two other parties waiting to be seated besides us. Other members of the wait staff would approach the hostess stand,  not even acknowledge us, and just grab menus and go. Again, absolutely ridiculous. We waited about 15 minutes and left.  There was a DJ (huge set and everything) at the bar. It was SUPER loud for a restaurant. This has been present all three times we have visited, and we have come on a Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday night.  We have given up on going to a TGIFriday's here.

Two stars being genres, waiters and waitresses were testing the food (fries) while grabbing it from kitchen counter. I place an order (2 burgers) over the phone for pick up, they said 15-20 mins, it took them 40 mins to prepare 2 burgers.  Never go to that location again.
It's a Friday's nothing to rant and rave about. Two stars because they recently got rid of reverse happy hour- and let's be honest, that's all Friday's is really good for.

This was probably the worst Fridays i have ever been too . Im typically not one to leave harsh reviews but this was necessary . Walked in and it being a Sunday night i was not expecting a crowd (it was extremely dead ! Maybe 10 tables with people spread out through the restaurant . I was like no problem cool so we shouldn't have a problem with slow service We had been seated promptly by our hostess & waitress had introduced herself &  took our order & got our drinks she kind of avoided much i contact and looked like she was kind of shy & when we were sat down i saw another couple having a hard time with the food the food they have been served . Me thinking (maybe they are just those kind of cranky food critiquing people ) i got pot stickers to start off and they were great hot & crispy  but what did they throw cabbage & carrots all over the plate maybe asian-esque thing whatever then i had gotten the bbq braised beef tostada i looked at this think and was just sooo confused . Why was there more cabage and carrots everywhere , where was the meat & why does this bbq sauce taste like boiled soy sauce . Literally like holy salt lick .
