In the end though the service wasnt the problem & exept for taking 30 minutes for the check . Truth is i probably wouldnt come back here .

So we went there for the endless appetizers.  Our server was great We ordered 2 apps one came out first and we were told the other one would be out shortly. Well about 5 mins later I asked the server about my app, he said he had asked the cook to make the app and the response he got was oh ok.   I went to speak to someone about it and came across a table of management. Told them what had happened and that it was ridiculous that a server would be talked to like that. I think it's ridiculous that the server didn't think he could go right to a manager to report the cook.  Then I got a manager squat down next to the table and tell me how sorry he was but made no effort to offer anything, maybe would've been nice for him to tell the server to bring the bill to him so he could make an adjustment, something as simple as taking our 6 dollar dessert. .surprise and delight your guests would be a great policy.  I really don't know how to rate this particular experience. The food was good. The service was good other than the above. The recovery was horrible.

Bad service. Staff kept giving us excuses why we couldn't get a table in a timely manner.they said 15 minutes. We waited atleast 30 minutes. then the shift Manager came out and kept giving us lame excuses why they couldn't get their act together. The restaurant wasn't even packed! Just terrible experience.

My family, with two young kids under 6, have visited this particular location twice recently and came away pleased both times.  This location has been recently updated so looks clean and well-organized inside.  The service was particularly good for a chain restaurant leading me to think this outlet is well-managed.  Beyond that, both my wife and I were very happy with our meals on both occasions.  I don't know if this is true across all TGI Fridays, but I felt like the food was surprisingly fresh and original.  We went at off-times, early for lunch on weekends, so the restaurant was not crowded and service was quick.  Maybe that is a factor in our favor that would not apply at all times, but I have been to other chain restaurants at roughly the same time on weekends and they are chaotic.  I was very impressed by this location and will go back again soon.  Note that this is a review of this particular location and not of TGI Fridays in general -- we went to a different location on a recent trip and were thoroughly disappointed.  The King Street TGI Fridays is doing something right.

This is my third time to this Friday's and last time  The food was good as always  but I had the worst server  he was very slow and to redeem my Groupon he took my phone in the back he was gone for a good 3 to 4 minutes  I was very upset about that anything could have happen to my iPhone 7 plus I will not be  returning  to this Friday's  Not to mention its the middle of fall and the air was pumping
It was nice but server was off track we ordered drinks and food and utensils wasn't on the table, but food and drinks came fast

The gender challenged waitress was terrible. I have spent my hard earned money in this establishment for over ten years and was verbally assaulted by the management. The one star is for the bartender named Wagner. He's awesome. When he retires this place will go out of business. If half a star was an option that's what I would give.

To begin with, giving a one star would be being very generous. I ordered potato skins and they came at the same time as my meal. They told me they were out of buns for the burgers and then came back a minute later saying they found one... Then I see them serving another order to someone else with a fresh hamburger bun. I'm just no understanding... Mine was stale. I tried to let one of the servers know and she responded to me very rudely saying "I'm not your waiter" we were just trying to get the manager. I am absolutely disappointed with this visit. Never coming back to this Friday's!!! Not to mention my friend's drink has taken longer than food to be ready... You don't need to cook a frickin drink, it takes very little preparation.

So me and my friend decided to go to Fridays to eat but I guess that wasn't a good choice because we had the worst experience there, it took them 15 min to greet us and also had the worst server she was complaining about how tired she was and rolling eyes and didn't really want to be bother with us I feel if she was tired she should have went home instead of us feeling unwelcomed.

One star is a huge stretch. They get 1 star for the ac being on, on a hot summer day.  ATROCIOUS service. We came to fridays, were seated and for FIFTEEN MINUTES nobody even came to take our drink order. We hailed the person who was supposed to our waitress, who disappeared without taking any order, or even saying hi, and NEVER returned. I went up to the host and asked him to send our waitress over, he did ZERO. in fact, he had the audacity to tell me to just be patient he's working on it. We're TWENTY MINUTES IN, the waitress, the host and some dude- who turns out to be the manager, say we were seated in a section that's closed. They're having hushed hissy fights right there, on the dining floor. So I call fridays, while I'm IN fridays, and ask for the manager, and lo and behold the manager is Gerrick aka some dude. I explain we have now been seated for 20 minutes and not served, and he says ok thanks, and HANGS UP. We walked right out of there. Do NOT waste your time, or your money at this crock of shit Fridays. They are a disgrace and the service is non existent and BULLSHIT at best.

This is for both the food and GrubHub delivery. If I could give no stars, I would. Aggravating and disappointing are probably the most accurate way I could describe both services and products. I ordered a set of appetizers and an entree for several friends. I get a call saying that the potstickers are out. I request an extra portion of one of the other appetizer. The person on the other end says, "so loaded potatoes"? I'm looking at my order and nowhere did I order this. I reiterate that I don't want anything with cheese so no potatoes. What did I get? Yep. An order of loaded potatoes. To add insult to injury, the order was cold, the chicken was overcooked and burnt, and the potatoes looked like it had been sitting awhile. You know the kind that looks dried and shriveled and unappetizing.  I called grub hub only to be told they can't do anything for a) not getting my order right, and b) getting the food cold. Mind you, it was grub hub that got my order, not TGIF, so there's no excuse that the restaurant got it wrong. It's also not the restaurant's fault that I got it cold. The bad thing with the restaurant was overcooking everything.  NEVER AGAIN GRUB HUB. EVER. OH yeah.. They charged me $45 for all of this. Crap food. Crap service. Crap customer service. Disappointing.

Went here a month or two ago with some friends. Good decor, pretty good waiter/server, crappy food, aha. Well my dish was crappy to say the least...I guess.. It was just really..bland? Boring? Something or other. Some might say that I shouldn't have expected much from TGIF but I think I paid a decent amount to get something that was at least...decent. Overall, nothing special. People are raving about the happy hour and what not but I guess it's too bad I'm not old enough to rave about that too, hah. I honestly wouldn't go here again though. 2/5, pass.

Why but why did I came here. Went out with my friends to have some drinks to celebrate. And waiter is always asking us what we got. I don't understand you have that tablet to have everything down but you still had to ask us again and again. This place is not even busy and our drinks are taking forever to come like 15 minutes. I'm definitely not coming back here, I'm eating and I don't have my drink. Not a happy customer at all.

So we came in at 5:30 the host sat us and I guess she thought that the bartender was going to take care of us but when I asked him he told us that " you have to ask the host for a server". I told her she said "someone would be right over".....No we waiting another 15 mins before we got up and left. Mind you we waiting a total of 30 mins for someone. They didn't even offer us water. I am also in the Industry so I try to be more understanding but this was unacceptable. They need better management and staff for sure!
Visited my favorite fridays today and received excellent service. Keep up the good work. Bryan was awesome.

I will give 5 stars if they hadn't taken away my parmesan fries. Otherwise the customer service is great. Good greeting when u come in...waiter/waitresses are friendly and Managers will go etra mile to solve any rising issues. Bring back my fries for 5star review. Thanks

Just walked out of this restaurant. They failed to let us know there were no burgers. So after I ordered my burger they let me know they were out. Decided to order chicken club, turns out they didn't have chicken either! Server was nice. But I know what I was craving and having to re order 3 times was a no no for me.

We traveled from Chesterfield to Alexandria to celebrate my wife's birthday. This Friday's was across the street from where we stayed. We went in and ordered take-out. Well, that was interesting. There was a man in front of us that waited 35 minutes for his order, so I don't have to tell you how long we waited. My wife ordered chicken tenders, fries and kale soup. That appeared to be easy for him to put in. I ordered the turkey burger with bacon and onions, mashed potatoes and broccoli. He couldn't find turkey burger so he had to get help to find it. Then he couldn't add the bacon and onions, so he had to get help. When it came to my mashed potatoes and broccoli, he had to get help. It took me 15 minutes just to place my order. When I got my order, I has two little clovers of broccoli and my mashed potatoes had cheese in them and I can eat cheese. The gave us no utensils or napkins. They were not busy at all but while I am waiting for my food, I shouldn't have to listen to staff complaining about what they are or are not going to do. It was just an experience that I wouldn't wish upon anyone.

Worst service ever.  Took us over an hour to get our food, and it was cold when we got it.  Took another 45 minutes to get checks.  Bright side was the server, who was friendly but inexperienced. Corporate needs to step in and shake up the management.

Very very bad choice restaurant. I went there with some friends and they treated us poorly, waitress never came to check up on us. On top of that the food was disgusting, I asked for a well done burger and they gave me a burnt tasteless patty. DO NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL.

When we initially walked in it took us about 10 minutes to be greeted, many workers walked by and looked at us, then walked away. Finally a guy walked up asking if we had been helped yet, and we told him no. He said he would be right back and came back maybe five minutes later im sure after asking what server was available. We were seated in Matt's section and It looked like he had the majority of the tables. He was quick and the food came out in a timely manner. We ordered an appetizer with wings mozzarella sticks, and pretzels. Also I ordered the whiskey brownie to start as I dont like missing out on dessert all the time. It was all very good. Then I ordered a build your own burger and asked for np onions or pickles and it came with both, after removing them I had troubles keeping my burger together.  It had bacon and guacamole which wouldnt stay on the bun. The guacamole kept falling off and the burger Pattie wouldn't stay on the bun. The fries were nothing special and came with a side of ranch I requested and an additional pink sauce, maybe a buffalo ranch? Not really certain. I would give 4 stars but seriously,  I hate not being acknowledged by workers. Its not that hard to say someone will be right with you. I dont care what your job is. If I hadn't been with my family, I would have left.

We just walked out because the restaurant was so dirty. The entrance floor was wet and sticky, dried coke on the wall by our table, the table had BBQ sauce on the edge and got on my boyfriend's shirt. When he went to the bathroom to rinse his shirt there was an employee in there cleaning, which is good, but she didn't leave so he could use the bathroom which is odd.

I came here with a large group for a farewell party. They had the table set up for us (even though we were late and everyone in the party wasn't there at once). We all ordered from their endless appetizers promotion, and they were very generous. They didn't mind us all ordering a different appetizer and having everyone on the table pick from each others' plates. I'm pretty sure that's not how the promotion was supposed to go, but better for us!  I got the boneless wings, which are essentially breaded chicken chunks, not close to wings at all. The food was all right. Exactly what you'd expect from a Friday's. The service was really good, despite us having a large group. As soon as they saw our plates almost empty, they'd ask if we wanted another round of appetizers.  But the thing that stood out the most to me was the live DJ in the restaurant. As the sun set, the music progressively got louder and louder. It was an interesting experience to say the least. I don't know if I'll be back, and if we just got a really great waitress, but my experience was definitely something.

Been here a few times. Every time I've had a great experience...except for this last time. I came on a Monday and unlike usual no one came and opened the door for me as I walked up. When I walked in there were two young ladies at the host stand. Both of which looked at me but did not greet me. I stood there in front of them for s few seconds before walking off and seating myself at the bar.  I asked the bartender if I could speak with a manager. The manager came up to me I explained to him what happened. Informed him that I didn't want sympathy or anything free I just wanted him to make sure that his employees were doing their job because I did find it rude that they did not at least say hello. He apologized and walked off.  A few minutes later he returned to me and said that he reviewed the camera and that it looked as if I was going straight to the bar. Really? How dare you return to a customer and try to justify a complaint on your employees and make me feel as if I'm wrong for feeing offended? Regardless if I was going to the bar or not neither of them opened the door, like they are trained to do, and neither of them said hello.  I will not be returning here ever again. Which is sad because I love Fridays but I love customer service more.
Love this place. Great bartenders and helpful staff. The atmosphere is always good and there is plenty going on.

You either love it or hate it.  I came here back2back.  My 1st was unenjoyable. It took just over an hour and a half for my food to come out.  Although it took long, the manager came to apologize.  The second time I came out, it was the complete opposite. Quick turn around on food, and taste was by far the better.  Overall it's a solid 3.5.

I went to Fridays on a Saturday night. The server was great. However halfway through our meal, we noticed a roach crawling on the wall. We told our waitress, and she moved us to another table.  A manager NEVER came over to apologize about the insect or even just to check on us. The waitress dropped the check off and there was no discount, no nothing. I finally had to ask to speak to a manager. The GM came out apologized, gave us two free appetizer cards and took some money off of the check.  If I had not asked to speak to someone, they would have never came to our table. I've been going to this Fridays for a long time and it seems like they can never get their stuff together. I won't be returning.

i went there with my family to have a nice moment but the service was so bad bad and the manager is a a**h****. I waited 45 minutes for my drinks, my order was messed up. and at the end they give us a check who was not correct. The manager treated us like we cannot pay the bill, with an attitude that i saw before. anyway the food was good but the service sucks big time. not going to that location anymore in the futur. not deserve even a star.
The service was great but their food presentation was not up to par. My wings barely had any sauce. Hopefully my next experience will be better.

I'm partial to Friday's in general.  They always have great appetizer specials, along with the drink specials.  One can easily eat and drink merrily for cheap! This is also a great location for NFL games to check out.  Crowd is always enthusiastic and the bartenders and wait staff too.

Great HH. $3 Blue Moon, $4 wine, $5 Jack & Coke I experienced great service from the staff. Although HH applied only to those sitting at or surrounding the bar, I asked if we could still get HH and the manager came to us and said that would be alright. He was friendly and seemed happy to help. It was extremely packed and my steak didn't come out the way I asked (medium rare).  So 3 stars, great service but food was not so great.

Some reason there has been changes to this location. or change of management not sure which. Here goes TGI Fridays has specials almost every night. Wednesday is Martini night -the bar kept running out of martini glasses. What gives, can you afford more that 25 glasses? Okay so for the cheap price every one is there. --I saw stuff about the St. Patrick's weekend. so I decided to wait until Monday the actual day to get my green beer. 3/17/2014. Got there about 7 pm -got one glass of green beer they ran out of green food coloring. WTH and why not the decorations, they were there a couple of years ago. -Is it all business with this place ?What happened to fun time, this is where people go to relieve the stress of the day.  Ever since décor changed and they took down "Wagners" jersey, this place is going down hill. So TGIF what gives????

Ive been eating at this location since I was a child (mid 20s now) and its usually NOT bad, with the exception of my last two visits. Once, the waiter was awesome! his NAILS, however, were brown claws. they were each about an inch long and sharp! mind you, this is a man. it just looked disgusting, although he was great. next visit, i order nachos for my entre (no sharing!). 30 minutes later my waiter is apologizing. no big deal, i get it. then, he brings me burnt nachos. not all of them were burnt (4 of 10) but the others just looked plain nasty. I eat these every single time i go, so I know exactly how they are supposed to look. I tell the server, and he comes back with a plate asking me to place the 4 on there and that he'll replace them. in the end, i said screw it, and left. he removed the nachos and the wings my brother got (which he didnt bring the sauce for) so i did leave him $5. he was also very sweet. we have to remember that its the COOKS that are the usual dirt bags. they come begging for the job and then get upset when people come to order food?  last thing, not a good place for kids... if you care about them. i dont know why anyone would order any of those things for their child, but hey..
Sat at the table for 20 minutes. No one came to take our drink order or anything. Not busy at all just bad service. Not going back.

Good food, good drinks, good bartenders, decent service.  It's Fridays, after-all. What can you honestly expect!? Always check for coupons when going here. You can almost always get money off the bill or BOGO dinners!

Came during thirsty thursdays, and every tgi location is so different.  This one is always overly congested, not my fav place. Most of the bartenders are on top of their game but there was 1 that forgot about us and I had to ask 1 of the other bartendars help... it just depends on the atmosphere u like,  this 1 is with a bunch of loud drunk ppl, but I guess that's what a bar is supposed to be.

I was curious to go to a Fridays after their remodel (haven't been to one in years).  This particular location was probably not the best choice. - Not sure how they manage there hosting, but everyone who had to com ein was told to have a seat to wait, but there were lots of tables available.  If the hostess was busy, the person asking you to wait should have seated you.  I witnessed this on the way in and the way out, so it seemed tio be a trend. -Bathrooms (both) were disgusting.  The mens room was trashed.  When it gets that bad, it takes time to happen.  My question, then, is did no staff member use the bathroom all day long?  It would surely have been noticed. -Menu was over priced by far. -My server was pretty good, and th food was good. -Restaurant was overall dirty Even though the food and service was decent, I would not go back because of the other factors. Update: I returned to this location after over a year, just because a family member had a coupon.  It was the worst experience I ever had in a restaurant, ever, from top to bottom.   -Dirty place, bathrooms were bad, women's room toilets were overflowing.  Staff was told, but seemed disinterested. -Food came out not only inaccurate to what was ordered, but inaccurate to the menu description.  Also, some food never even made it out. -The wait was near 2 hours to get the main course, over 20 min, for the appetizer. -Manager tried to avoid us when trying to seek resolution to the issues. -Server had two tables only but was hard to find. -A hostess walked away from us when we were trying to express concern about the poor services. -After complaining, Fridays didn't seem too concerned about learning more about the issues, they just kept trying to push me off to the same management that created the problems. DO NOT GO HERE!
Service is always slow...and the music is way too loud.  Parking is a mess since groups of bikers use cones to block a bunch of spaces that are never filled.

Just stopped by for a couple drinks to get the juices flowing before heading elsewhere. Drinks were fine and the price was right. They over served some bozo who threw up near the bar across from us which provided a bit of entertainment as he was escorted/carried out. The bartender and staff are cool.

The best word that I would choose to characterize this TGI location is "inconsistent". Inconsistent quality of food, inconsistent service. We have been to this place about 5 or 6 times (we literally live around the corner, so it is convenient for us), and some of our experiences could be 3 and a half stars, and some were definitely one star. The food is very generic, but not too bad. The wings, the ribs and some of the salads are decent. Some mixed drinks are good. But the service can be really horrible. During our last time there, everything that could go wrong with the service did go wrong: slow, wrong dishes, forgotten orders, requests like "no ice" ignored and forgotten, etc., etc. So, not a totally awful place, but very inconsistent.

My wife and I stopped in around 6:30 last Saturday, It was not at all crowded so we thought we could go in and eat quickly. When we walked in two woman had their back to us and were leaning on the hostess stand. We finally said excuse me and she did not seem to like us interfering with her conversation. She said are you here for dinner? She assumed we wanted to eat in the lounge area and pointed and said sit anywhere. We told her we wanted to sit more in the dining area and she said "OK it will be about 20 minutes" and pointed at the bench for us to wait. We then looked around and noticed that there was hardly any other patrons on the floor. I then asked why we had to wait 20 minutes with their being no other customers. She then said that all the servers were currently on break. After trying to absorb this for a minute, My wife and I verified what we actually had just heard and walked  out and went over to Famous Dave's. I will admit that this was a first.

TGIF has always been my favorite place, but this location is not the best. We have been here 3 times and never been impressed with the service; however the food is always yummy.  The first time we went, the waiter somehow lost our credit card, and it got stolen right from under our noses. He was very apologetic and the manager came over to our table and apologized and said he would take care of our ticket, as he should have, but again the food was awesome; however every time we have been here the women's bathroom has been nasty.  Another time we went, we were seated and it took forever for our server to come over and take drink order, then it took another 30 min to get him to come back to place order, then it took about an hour from him to bring our order, only to have given it to the table behind us "hello wrong table, that's my steamed broccoli" lol we decided to just leave and let the other table have our order, then we mentioned to hostess on our way out of there. So the stars I give are based on the awesome food and great specials!!!

Went yesterday with some friends for dinner. I was extremely disappointed. We were put on a wait when the restaurant wasn't even crowded. We decided to sit at the bar while we wait to be seated. I don't even know where to start with the bartender. I never caught his name but I don't understand how he's working in the service industry......He didn't smile when he greeted us or at all for that matter the whole visit. He is very unkept and has the longest dirtiest finger nails I've ever seen. I first got a margarita on the rocks with salt. Tasted horrible I don't recommend it too much sweet and sour mix just tasted like juice to me. Next I got the white peach sangria. I was disgusted when he touched all the fruit before putting it in my drink. I payed in cash at the end of the night and the idiot didn't even give me my change back. I had to wait 10 minutes till he came back to the bar. I saw him and the other bartender sitting at a table talking with people. Worst service ever I am never going back.

Came in here today, it was very crowded and a long waiting line, 6 of us and a couple groups came in that got seats before us. It took at least an hour for our food to come, and the waitresses were very confused about whose order was whose. Gave us the wrong order the first time. And when our food came it was a bit cold or warm. But our waiter was very great! He was friendly, funny and very nice. Wouldn't recommend coming when it's very packed. Overall good food and environment! :)

Wow. What an experience. Veterans Day at Fridays. We will never forget this lunch. Talked the gf into getting lunch here since it's right by us and we have never been there. I don't even know where to begin, but I'll do my best.    ALERT: table next to you asking their waiter why he waited 40 minutes to tell them the kitchen had 86'ed THE RIBS he had ordered means we should have rushed for the emergency exit ASAP. But, what's the worst that could happen to us?    Let's see, 15 minutes to get 2 sodas. Then 45 minutes to get a salad and a burger. Breaking point was the burger came missing the bacon. NOBODY FORGETS MY BACON. Well, that's going overboard, but the manager 'fessed up they ran out of bacon also. Ironically, we had just seen a TGI Fridays commercial for ribs smothered in a bacon sauce before coming to lunch.    The only reason I didn't give 1 star is because the manager and the waiter handled the situation the only way they could, by comping our whole meal. They explained it was veterans day and all Vet's meals were free. So they were flying thru food extremely fast. I feel sorry for the 15 people waiting outside for tables on our way out, not sure what was left in the restaurant for them to eat.

I went here with a friend a couple of nights ago and the service was horrible. We weren't acknowledged for about 10 mins after we sat down even though we saw our waitress, Jessica, tending to other tables around us. Our drinks came, water, after another ten minutes and then she proceeded to take our order. The food was all right but the service sucked.

I usually love tgi fridays  but this location sucks. Went in tonight, attempted to order 3 times, with each time being told that they didn't have that item available. No new tostado nachos, no tomato mozzarella salad, no tomatos for my salad. You're a restaurant, order what you need. Then to top it off, our server tries to charge us full price for our happy hour drinks. Pass on this place.

I have been coming to this restaurant since high school in 1987 and this was the worst service I have ever had. I had a new waiter only 2 days on the floor. She forgot to put our order in. No refills and she was alone without a trainer. Won't be back very disappointed. Damn finally the food comes out an hour later and it's cold. This place should be shut down.

My mom and I went here our last night in the DC area. We were looking thru the Entertainment coupon book (yes they still make those) to see what we had a coupon for in the area. I checked the reviews on Yelp and decided to take a chance. We didn't wait long once we were seated and our waitress was attentive for the most part. She was a little spacey but she had a pleasant attitude. My mom and I ordered the shakers off of the drink menu. I had the berry mojito and she had a mango something. We both agreed they were really good but probably only had a splash of liquor in them. We both ordered the jack daniels burger which was DEEELISH. However, our fries were meh. I don't know what it is with me and sweet potato fries but when will restaurants learn that when they aren't cooked properly they taste like the freezer?? OMG! My mom asked for more fries because hers weren't cooked all the way either (she had regular french fries). That was the only downside to our dinner. The atmosphere was very loud and that was probably only because there were several basketball games on the tv. This location is about 4 miles away from the center of Old Town Alexandria. #Yelp100

Well to start off this is my first ever review. I have never to place that has been so bad or so good that I've been compelled to write a review. In this case it was that bad. I have been to several other fridays locations that i like. I figured this one couldn't be any different and I was wrong. To start off the hostess was running around franticly on a what looked like a very slow wednesday. she sat us at small table smushed up on another group of people eating when clearly there were far better suited areas to be placed. Our table was stickier than the second floor of mister days in clarendon. We were greeted by a very not friendly face asking us what we wanted to drink no greeting at all. for the better part of our visit she made us feel as if asking for anything was a burden. It took 10 mins to get our drinks which were a non sweet tea and a water. The food was as usual to what you get at other locations, what turned to disgust for me was the plate being thrown on the table and her just walking away. This is the service i expect from a McDonalds not a from a company that just spent millions to re brans their look and name when they should have rebranded the staffs training. Seeing sour faces the second you walk in will only ruin your experience. I highly recommend finding a different restaurant or fridays before even letting this location cross your mind.

I have been too many TGI Fridays and this by far remains the worse. I held back on my review the first time I was here and thought it would be better the next time I come here-but nothing's changed. The service was terrible. Orders were not put through timeously. Asked for sauces and they were never brought. And just because one of my guests had an out of state licence they could not get served alcohol (totally ridiculous). Our waitress Ladonna did not do a great job at all. On that note probably will not come here again unless we have no other option!!!!!

Went to Friday's on a Tuesday evening for a family dinner.  The hostess was polite and seated us in a booth (I requested).  The three of us sat there for 5 minutes and no one had come to the table.  I got up to ask the hostess to send the manager over to our table came back and it was another 5 minutes until the waitress showed up.  We ordered drinks.  By the time she came back we were more than ready to order.  Food came out in good time and was good.  We had to track down our waitress for water refills, etc.  The manager never came over to the table (I will be writing a letter).  When we left our waitress was chillin' with the hostess and three other employees at the front door. PROS: food was good CONS: service is terrible

Our polite waitress was about the only positive aspect of our experience. The food quality is much less than mediocre. Took 1.5hr just to bring out a salad, entree dish and side salad...during non rush time! As well, Due to glitch in the back ("currently unable to serve this entree to customers"), one entree was not served. Forgot utensils with food=added wait (table across from us had same issue). In fact, the section where we were seated was reverberating with dissatisfied customers. In end, 4 people got 2 entrees. Sis called her salad a "breath of stale air." After 2 hrs, we rushed out (night time), hungry, to find more food.

Hey, it's TGIF so don't expect 5 star dining here.  But what you CAN expect is some pretty tasty food.  They've upgraded their menu and I have to say that I was quite pleased with the new selections.   I had the Ahi tuna with guacamole and jalapeños, Mac n cheese bites with bacon and chicken skewers...and it was all surprisingly good and only $15!  My husband had the Jack Daniels BBQ ribs sampler...I believe it came with fried shrimp and chicken.  Of course I sampled his sampler...also pretty good.  The one thing that sucked was the service...it was horrible!  We waited a good 10 minutes before I decided to inform the hostess that nobody had taken our order yet.  I mean...we had nothing to drink and no waiter/waitress.  That's just piss poor if you ask me!  Ultimately found out that there was some sort of mix-up with one server thinking the other was supposed to wait on us - um, how do you not know what section to work???  Yea, beats the heck outta me!   At any rate, if you're in need of a pretty decent meal for a reasonable price, stop on by!  Just make sure your server knows the he/she is supposed to wait on you...blah.

Awful experience! The server was nice, however, we had to wait more than 30 minutes for drinks from the bar (including my daughter's flavored lemonade) while walk-ups received their drinks immediately. Then 30 minutes for food that was HORRIBLE! My friends Cajun chicken pasta had so much oil that it gathered around the edge of her entire plate! It was disgusting! Then my friend's bacon burger had ONE piece of bacon on it! My steak had so much fat and gristle that it was ridiculous. The manager came at the end and did MINIMAL to try and make amends! I WILL NOT RETURN!! You have been warned.

This spot is ok. The customer service has been decent anytime I visit. The food isn't anything to write home about but it's good depending on what you get. I like that it's close. It's a good place to go for a meal.

To start off, I have a problem when I am not greeted by the hostess at the door. At least say "hello," don't just stare at my family waiting for us to say something. When the hostess sat us down, the table was obviously not cleaned well, but she decided to cover the stuck-on sauce with the menus. I asked her for a cloth so I could clean the table... she wasn't happy about it. So our waitress came and took our orders. My boys ordered appetizers that included mozzarella sticks. When they started eating, ALL of the sticks were hollow. No cheese inside. I'm sure the cheese just escaped during cooking. But did they put all the hollow ones aside and just try to give it to some suckers? We asked a random worker to speak to the manager. Our waitress came back and said, "I can take care of it for you. You didn't have to call the manager." I so did not like that comment. I know she didn't cook the food. If a customer asks for the manager, get the manager. They did end up giving us an order of mozzarella sticks, but the new order was short 2 sticks. The waitress brought out the 2 sticks and all of them were filled with cheese. Problem corrected. But I still didn't like the attitudes. I don't plan on coming back here again.

This is one of the oldest Fridays in Northern Virginia.  It is the first one I ever visited back in the 1980s when I was a teenager growing up in Alexandria.  The location is kind of crazy because it sits at the corner of one of the scariest intersections around and half the parking is located in the garage of an office complex. The food is TGIF Americana - family dining with Applebees, Chilis, Ruby Tuesday type stuff but for about a third more the price.  In my opinion the drinks and bar scene is the best part of Fridays.  It's usually a very friendly place and typically provides for a decent meet market for singles in a casual setting. This was the first time I have been to this restaurant in years (I was treating my Mom to a birthday lunch with family), and I must say that they have kept the place looking new and very clean.  The tables and restrooms were crystal clean. The service was great - we were seated to our preference and served promptly.  There was a couple of greeters who came to our table to enquire whether we were being taken care of and the food was great for everybody - but not worth the price.  Of the other casual American chains, I think Friday's must be the most expensive.
Haven't been to a Friday's since they updated their decor,  have to say is much buddy and I think they new menu items are pretty good!

Good food not worth the price tho. The service was horrible. They had one server having 5 tables that day so of course she messed up the orders. I felt bad for them doing that to her but a jobs a job so they have to do it. Overall i will not come back here again for sure.

Chain restaurant food is usually the same nationwide so my review is mainly based on the service. This location is often understaffed and has long wait times with lots of open seats. In addition, the servers are not attentive. On one occasion we actually had to chase down our server to pay after waiting 20 minutes after we had finished our meals. And this was on a Sunday early evening, not on a Friday or Saturday night. Friday's has great prices and decent food. I'm just not a fan of the service at this location.

I sure have to give this place a good review because the service was simply spectacular and kudos for our Waitress.  She was super on point and attentive throughout our entire visit.  With all the people there watching the game, it actually felt like I was there...  the place is definitely rambunctious but it replicated the feeling that I would have at a college football game so get into it and enjoy! The food was also more than excellent!  Boneless buffalo chicken wings, Jack Daniels chicken strips, Spinach and Artichoke dip with tortilla chips, $4 mojito, $4 long island iced tea, $5 blackberry margarita. Anyway, I will come back here again with my friends, for all the same reasons, good food, great service, nice people, and not at all hard on the wallet.

Overall clean but the waiting staff isnt very good at their job. Slow service without ever checking on guests. Our server didnt know they were out of several things on the menu last time. The only saving grace that kept them at a 3 is the manager took care of any problems we had.

OK. I waited to do this review after my first visit to see if my second visit would be better.  I visited this Fridays twice in a week (YES! I love Fridays).  One was on a Friday and the other was that next Saturday. So that Friday was by far the worst.  The waitress was pregnant so I gave her one of the two stars for "trying".  I ordered chicken and shrimp pasta.  It was GROSS to say the least and I eat this dish many times per month at other locations.  Back to the waitress was so forgetful and was not paying attention to our table.  I was trying to send back my food and get something else but she NEVER showed up.  I ended up sitting there eating off of my friends plate with him. I ended up getting another meal to go about 45 minutes later.  I WAS NOT SATISFIED. The next Saturday.  I went in with a clear mind and forgot about last weeks mishaps.  We got in and was seated promptly (finally a great start to what I thought was going to be great). WRONG. We waited for our waitress for a good 30 minutes. (I was ready to leave but he insisted we stayed since everything else was closed that was close in distance).  So she came over and took our drink orders and walk away so quick, we couldn't order the food (by this time we already knew what we wanted and even the dessert and additional drinks we wanted). BUT she walked away. MORAL OF THE STORY: Service is bad here.  Food is gross. IDK if they are not preparing it like the other locations but it was nasty.

I never thought there would be face painting at a TGI Friday's on St. Patrick's Day. I have no idea what flights of fancy occur at bars in chain restaurant on weekday evenings, but shamrocks and leprechauns aren't part of my imagined mise en scene. However, as I had neglected to wear any grass-hued articles proclaiming my love of all things Irish, I was grateful for the chance to sport something green and avoid the pinching that would certainly ensue when I met my party. Imagine, then, my disappointment at discovering it was all a sham. After scores of pinching fingers finished perpetrating their nefarious deeds, I sat at a large table with my party and ordered a rum and coke from our server, from whom curls of steam were slowly rising, such was his frustration at working on a holiday. My drink arrived the color of straw, not so much potent as vitriolic, the rum a liquid splash of fermented sugar cane vengeful to those that had abused its delicate reeds.  The appetizers for the table, including mozzarella sticks, sesame chicken bites, an Italian quesadilla with sausage and chicken, and cheddar sliders with a cloying barbecue sauce, were saturated with sugar and sodium, and were even trashier than I remember Friday's food being (from my underage days). I believe the sliders were a mixture of beef and pork, such was their lard quotient. At least the food was served at reasonably paced intervals. As Michael Jackson began blasting from the speakers, I pleaded with my party to uproot and venture elsewhere. Delicately blotting emeraldine beer from their lips, they finally acquiesced to my Irish wheedling. Never again.

I really wish this place wasn't so close to my place of residence. It has been a default dinner destination a couple of times to go if cooking at home is just too big of a production but I'm really too lazy to venture anywhere farther than a quarter mile.  The food here is OK, nothing too wretched or delicious. They don't do a terrific job of timing the appetizers and main entrees and the last time we ordered an appetizer, it was cold.  It can be pretty chilly in one of the nonsmoking sections and service visits can be sporadic. Some servers are better than others.  Overall, this place is a meal. Nothing less, definitely nothing more.

This place is like Cheers - everybody knows your name (at least the bartenders - or you know theirs).  Great deals in your email if you're a Gimme More Perks member, food is pretty good - they change up their menu every so often and drinks are super great!  Awesome happy hour specials til 9p every day.  Old neighborhood gem..

I was going to say 3 stars since it is after all, just a Friday's. However, after thinking it through I had to add a star back in because their JD burgers are satisfying in a way no other burger can be for me. Yes, parking sucks. Yes, they get extremely busy on weekends. Yes, on occasion it seems like my food is taking forever. And yes, my one Jack Daniels burger has (if I remember correctly) over 1500 calories in it. But no, I don't care. We don't go to Friday's for a healthy meal.  We go pretty much just for the JD burger, sweet potato fries, happy hour beer (strawberry lemonade slush for me), and fried apps with tons of grease. In one meal here I can consume my entire days worth of calories, which I know is horrible. So, we usually cut the burgers in half and take home half the meal for lunch the following day. You know, so we clog our arteries slowly over time. Just remember when you come here that you aren't going to get a five star meal. Your going to get what you get served at any other chain restaurant...food that is probably bad for you. Its just a matter of how they make that food taste. Do your heart a favor and don't come too often, and do your stomach a favor and get the JD burger!
Always great service and good food. I usually go on the weekends during the day so there hasn't  been any problem with wait or service. Every person who works here is super nice and very attentive.

If I could give no stars I would because this was the worst experience ever here. I used to go to this location all the time about a year ago. I decided to go this day and the service was the worst I have ever experienced. The waitress took 10 mins to bring our menu out, didn't introduce herself, then took another 15 mins to bring out our sodas, another 10 to take our order then finally 45 mins later brought our food. The food was not cooked to our request. She never told us her name. Then when the bill came she totally messed that up and didn't do the correct deal prices. She also tried to argue with me what my tgi member gift certificate was for trying to say was for an appetizer and not my meal. Then she took 10 mins to bring the correct receipt out and never apologized for the error. Needless to say ms. No name waitress received a poor tip and a poor review on the call to the service line.

I'm not a huge fan of chain restaurants like this, but when ordering a meal to go it's not bad.  We called in our order from work it is was ready in fifteen minutes just like they said.  I do really like their green bean french fries.

The worst experience I EVER had in a restaurant. I am a regular at the TGI Fridays in Fair Lakes and thought that this place was going to be the same or close to the same. I do not even know where to start. After a long day of working at DC as servers my husband, co-worker, and I decided to go here as it was on our way to where we needed to go. BIG MISTAKE. We were tired and hungry and we just wanted to sit down, get some beers, get good food, and relax for a bit before going to bed. Instead, we got HORRIBLE service from the restaurant as a whole. It took a long time to get our drinks and food. Then when the food finally came, one of the dishes (a salad) had cheese and we ordered it without it because one of us are cheese intolerant. It took another 10 min to get the salad. Also, my co-worker's dish consisted of rubbery uneatable chicken so we returned it. We did not act like jerks and we were polite and apologized for returning another dish back because we know how the restaurant business works. 1, 2, 5, 20 min passed and no sign of our server nor our food. We ordered at 1:10 am and by now it was 2:00 am. The best part is that we were on our second round of drinks when the security guard came and took our drinks that were practically untouched as we were waiting for the other dish to come so we can all eat together. The manager came and said that they had basically already closed the kitchen and had to start everything and kept saying he had to talk to the server to know what happened. We had also ordered a to go order at 1:10 and apparently the server never put it on the system. Long story short.... My co worker did not get his food nor his to go order for his wife and he was still charged the two beers he drank. As customer service should be, the LEAST the manager could have done is void his 2 beers. We left with the worst experience and my co worker left hungrier than when he came in. Even a McDonald Does better than this place. Save your self a trip and never come to this place. Horrible management and customer service i have had by far, and that is a lot to say as i go out to eat frequently and have been in many different places.

R and I stopped by on Sunday since it's right down the road from our apartment and we just wanted something simple and easy for dinner.   The foyer stunk when we walked in.  I have no idea what was causing the smell, but thankfully the odor was gone once you walked into the restaurant.  There was no one at the hostess stand, so we walked up to the bar and grabbed a seat.  It took a couple of minutes before our drink orders were taken.  The bartender informed us of the Happy Hour drink specials, but the beers we wanted weren't included in the HH special, which didn't upset us, but the bartender seemed kinda mad that we weren't getting half price Bud Lights.   The beers were good.  I had a Blue Moon and R had a Stella Artois.  They were cold and delicious.  None of that funky stale beer taste that we've been encountering with draught beers lately.   We ordered our meals next which wound up becoming quite a charade.   First off, my menu was stuck together, which always grosses me out.  I got over it though and decided on the Club Sandwich.  R wanted to try the American Chicken Sandwich, one of the new menu items.  Bartender informed us that they didn't have that, nor did they have the Pulled Pork Sandwich.  So R looked over the menu again and decided to try the Chicken Popper Sandwich (also a new menu item), "We don't have that" replied the bartender.  R was starting to get irritated.  For his third choice he wanted the Jack Daniels Burger, "We don't have that", the bartender replied again before quickly smiling and saying "Just kidding!".  Thank goodness she was kidding!  We also ordered the pot stickers as a starter. The pot stickers are my old standby at Friday's.  They are always good and the dipping sauce is very tasty.  If we had been given plates and not had to both eat off the plate the pot stickers were served on it would have been even better! Our main dishes arrived and neither one of us has any major complaints.  R enjoyed his burger and I enjoyed my club sandwich.  I kinda wish Friday's would go back to serving the club sandwiches on wheat bread like they used to though.  The ciabatta bread just makes the sandwich heavier and harder to get into your mouth, also, they were a little skimpy on the avocado.  I'm probably nitpicking though. A plus was the price, I think it was about $40 for two beers each (not part of the HH special), pot stickers, a burger and sandwich.  Not bad! We might be back.  It's close and inexpensive, but I think it will be a spot we'll only stop by if we're in a pinch.

My friends and I went to Fridays and Alexandria for our extended lunch on Tuesday, and a good time was had by all!  The service and food were really good, especially considering how crowded the place was.  But the best part of the meal was the Oreo Dessert, with not too many calories and not too sweet- it hit the spot!

The worst Chicken picatta I have EVER had. Came b/c menu was supposed to be improved. If it is improved heaven help the old menu. Evening started off bad when waiter insisted on carding us ... Everyone at table could have given him Medicare cards as IDs and with our grey hair we look it. Nothing improved after that. Desert (Tennessee Whiskey Cake) was good... Not exceptional. An experience not to be repeated. Had to give 1 star but in reality should have been minus 5.

This Fridays seems a bit old and run down, despite the newer Friday's Decor. 1. Great drink specials. $4.00 Long Islands/ $2.00 beers in the bar area, if you can find a table. Table service is bad. One time the manager came out and argued with us about the steak, saying it was in fact medium after he had cut all the way through it and found a sliver of pink remaining.  Maybe it is bad management, staff seems ok.   I think all in all Fridays may have gone downhill.

I am normally a huge fan of Friday's. Quick, inexpensive and good food. When my brother and I saw this Friday's we decided to stop because we were both excited to see one, primarily because we hadn't been in a while. We arrived at about 7:45 pm When we arrived the hostesses and host greeted us and then began to whisper amongst themselves.I'm assuming to figure out where to seat us. All three turned their backs to us and then one began to walk away, we asked if we were supposed to be following her. She said yes. Thanks for letting us know. Our server didn't get to us for a few minutes though when she arrived she was pleasant, she had some cool piercings on her chest.We ordered a triple play app. It was good. Our app made it to the table before our drinks. My brother and I both ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp. It was horrible. The chicken was dry, the mashed potatoes were terrible and the shrimp, we refused to even taste. We sent the food back for two sirloin with lobster sauce. We both ordered medium well. Twenty minutes later then came my steak cooked so well done you could barely cut it and my brothers was medium. I asked for a manager and he agreed the steak was overcooked and very dry and took it back to the kitchen. My brother ate his meal and I waited another twenty minutes for my steak, which was returned medium. Still bloody in the center. The manager came by after I had my second try on my second plate. It took him about twenty minutes to check in. I told him the steak was just ok. He said, Great! and then walked away. I surprised to see that I was charged for the meal when the check came. I didn't complain, it was now 10:15 and I just didn't have the energy to discuss why I shouldn't have had to pay for that experience. My waitress apologized alot through the meal. We obviously still tipped her what she deserved but the restaurant will never see us again.

This location has gone back and forth a lot for me.  Some times the food is awful and service is bad.  Last night we went in for the All you can eat wings @ the bar.  April was our waitress and she was great!  The food was exceptional.  My mojito's were well worth the 4 dollar happy hour.

I have always loved the day of the week "FRIDAY" and T.G.I. Friday's restaurants. True all restaurants are not the same with the cooks, bartenders, waiters, waitresses but this Friday's is another one of my cheers type places. They have a lot of regulars and it's always and interesting time. They have happy hour too with a few cocktails under $4 and most appetizers are half price. Call location for more details. Most happy hours are from 4 to 7 p.m. though.
cheap food. love the drinks. it gets busy. Get the tropical berry mojito shaker.
Good place for a quick and cheap meal in Shirlington. It is kind of like a Chipolte but with Mediterranean food. Good herbal teas.

We were close by and the kids wanted FRIDAYS!!! It was a Saturday around 6pm not busy!!!  We were sat at a table immediately !!! Then waited 20 minutes for the waiter to come my daughter had to go ask the host where our waiter was before one actually came!!! The one thing that bothers me the most is when I'm not greeted by the waiter in at  least 5 minutes especially when they are not busy!!! I love sizzling chicken and shrimp!!! The only thing I order no matter what new things are on there the rest of the meal and service was fine. They also song Happy Birthday to my son!!! The restaurant was also freezing!!! I love Fridays just not this one!!!
This used to be my favorite hang-out spot...what happened? Please bring back the old Fridays!

Called ahead to get a table for a party of 11 - no problem.  We were seated right away and then left alone for 15 minutes.  Finally a waiter came by and took our drink order.  Another 5-10 minutes went by, during which a different waiter came by to ask if we'd been served.   I ordered the sirloin, medium-rare.  I was served a well done steak that had obviously been microwaved.   One of my sons had ordered the sliders with a side salad.  We were told they were coming soon several times, and when we finally sent someone else to get them, it was obvious they'd been sitting under the heat lamp for 15-20 minutes.  The salad was half-cooked from the heat, the cheese on the sliders had melted and run out onto the plate. I've eaten at the Friday's in Springfield several times, and it's always pretty good.   This was AWFUL.
